Data Delivery¶

Data Deliverer¶

Data Deliverer, used by the Data Delivery System CLI.

Handled the login of all users, performs checks on the data and handles the upload and download of all files. Also keeps track of the delivery progress.

class DataDeliverer(creds=None, username=None, password=None, project_id=None, project_owner=None, pathfile=None, data=None, break_on_fail=True, overwrite=False)¶

Bases: object

Handles and keeps track of all data delivery related operations.

Instanstiates the delivery by logging the user into the Delivery System, checking the users access to the specified project, and uploads/downloads the data to the S3 storage.

Parameters

  • creds (str) – Path to file with user creds and project info

  • username (str) – User spec. username, None if creds used

  • password (str) – User spec. password, None if creds used

  • project_id (str) – User spec. project ID, None if creds used

  • project_owner (str) – User spec. project owner, None if creds used

  • pathfile (str) – Path to file containing file paths

  • data (tuple) – All paths to be uploaded/downloaded

  • break_on_fail (bool) – True if folder delivery should be cancelled on file fail

  • overwrite (bool) – True if deliver again - overwrite delivered files

break_on_fail¶

Cancel delivery on fail or not

Type

bool

overwrite¶

Overwrite already delivered files or not

Type

bool

method¶

Delivery method, put or get

Type

str

user¶

Data Delivery System user

Type

DSUser

project_id¶

Project ID to upload to/download from

Type

str

project_owner¶

Owner of the current project

Type

str

data¶

Paths and info to files

Type

dict

failed¶

Paths and info to failed files

Type

dict

bucketname¶

Name of S3 bucket to deliver to/from

Type

str

s3project¶

ID of S3 project containing buckets

Type

str

public¶

Project public key

Type

bytes

private¶

Project private key, b’’ if uploading

Type

bytes

_check_ds_access()¶

Checks the users access to the delivery system.

Makes a request to the Delivery System REST API, which in turn checks the database for the user and its corresponding information.

Returns

Information on whether delivery can proceed and user info.

access (bool): True if access to DS granted

s3_id (str): ID of the S3 project (on Safespring)

public_key (str): The projects public_key

error (str): Error message if any

project_id (int): Project ID

Return type

json

_check_user_input(creds, username, password) -> (<class 'str'>, <class 'str'>, <class 'int'>, <class 'int'>)¶

Checks that the correct options and credentials are entered.

Parameters

  • creds – File containing the users DP username and password, and the project relating to the upload/download. Can be used instead of inputing the creds separately.

  • username – Delivery System username

  • password – Delivery System password

Returns

Info about user if all credentials specified

username (str): Username

password (str): Password

project_id (int): Project ID

owner_id (int): Owner ID

Return type

tuple

_create_progress_output() -> (<class 'str'>, <class 'dict'>)¶

Create list of files and the individual delivery progress.

Returns

Information on start status for all files

str: Progressinfo (all files) to print to console dict: Files and their current delivery statuses

Return type

tuple

_data_to_deliver(data: tuple, pathfile: str) -> (<class 'dict'>, <class 'dict'>)¶

Puts all entered paths into one dictionary.

Gathers all folders and files, checks their format etc, if they have been previously delivered, and puts all information into one dictionary.

Parameters

  • data (tuple) – Tuple containing paths

  • pathfile (str) – Path to file containing paths

Returns

Two dictionaries with info on user specified files.

dict: Info on all files to be delivered

dict: Info on files which failed initial check

Return type

tuple

_finalize(info: dict)¶

Makes sure that the file is not in bucket or db and deletes if it is.

Parameters

  • file (Path) – Path to file

  • info (dict) – Info about file –> don’t use around with real dict

_get_download_info(item: str, files_in_db: dict, do_fail: bool) → dict¶

Gets info on file in database and checks if item exists in S3 bucket.

Parameters

item (str) – File or folder to download

Returns

Information on if file can be downloaded or not

Return type

dict

_get_project_files()¶

Get all files delivered within the specified project.

Returns

The API response contain all file information

Return type

json

finalize_delivery(file: str, fileinfo: dict) → tuple¶

Finalizes delivery after download from s3.

Decrypts, decompresses (if compressed in DS), and checks integrity.

Parameters

  • file (str) – Path to file

  • fileinfo (dict) – Information on file

Returns

Info on finalized file

bool: True if decryption etc successful

str: Path to new, delivered and decrypted file

str: Error message, “” if none

Return type

tuple

get(path: str, path_info: dict) -> (<class 'bool'>, <class 'str'>)¶

Downloads specified data from S3 bucket.

Parameters

  • path (str) – File to be downloaded

  • path_info (dict) – Name of downloaded file

Returns

Info on download success

bool: True if downloaded

str: Error message, “” if none

Return type

tuple

Raises

  • OSError – Creating directory failed

  • botocore.client.ClientError – Failed download

prep_upload(path: pathlib.Path, path_info: dict) → tuple¶

Prepares the files for upload.

Checks if the file should be delivered, sets the current process and processes the files.

Parameters

  • path (Path) – Path to file

  • path_info (dict) – Info on file

Returns

Info on success and info

bool: True if processing successful

Path: Path to processed file

int: Size of processed file

bool: True if file compressed by the delivery system

bytes: Public key needed for file decryption

bytes: Salt needed for shared key derivation

str: Error message, “” if none

Return type

tuple

put(file: pathlib.Path, fileinfo: dict) -> (<class 'bool'>, <class 'str'>)¶

Uploads specified data to the S3 bucket.

Parameters

  • file (Path) – Path to original file

  • fileinfo (dict) – Info on file

Returns

Info on upload success

bool: True if upload successful

str: Error message, ‘’ if none

Return type

tuple

Raises

botocore.client.ClientError – Upload failed

set_progress(item: pathlib.Path, processing: bool = False, upload: bool = False, download: bool = False, decryption: bool = False, db: bool = False, started: bool = False, finished: bool = False)¶

Set progress of file to in progress or finished, regarding the file checks, processing, upload or database.

Parameters

  • item (Path) – Path to file being handled

  • processing (bool) – True if processing in progress or finished

  • upload (bool) – True if upload in progress or finshed

  • db (bool) – True if database update in progress or finished

update_delivery(file: pathlib.Path, updinfo: dict) → bool¶

Updates data delivery information dictionary.

Updates the data dictionary with information from previous step, e.g. processing or upload etc.

Parameters

  • file (Path) – The files info to be updated

  • updinfo (dict) – The dictionary to update the info with

Returns

True if to continue with delivery

Return type

bool

Raises

DeliverySystemException – Data dictionary update failed

update_progress_bar(file, status: str, perc=0.0)¶

Update the status of the file and print out progress.

Updates the delivery status of the current file to the options found in STATUS_DICT: ‘Waiting to start…’, ‘Encrypting…’, ‘Decrypting…’, ‘Uploading…’, ‘Downloading…’, and two unicode symbols: A check mark, and a cross - symbolizing a finished delivery or a failure, respectively.

Parameters

  • file – File to update progress on

  • status (str) – Which stage the delivery is on

  • perc – Upload/Download percentage, 0.0 if not upl/dwnld

S3 Connection¶

S3 Connector.

Communicates with and handles operations related to Safespring S3, including deleting items from the bucket and performing checks on whether the files exist in the buckets.

class S3Connector(bucketname, project)¶

Bases: object

Connection to the Safespring S3 instance.

Keeps information regarding the resource, project and bucket currently in use, and handles S3-related checks.

Parameters

  • bucketname – Name of bucket to access

  • project – S3 project to access

project¶

S3 project ID

bucketname¶

Name of bucket to access

bucket¶

Bucket object to access

resource¶

S3 connection object

session¶

Session - needed for multithreading/processing

delete_item(key: str)¶

Deletes specified item from S3 bucket.

Parameters

key (str) – Item (e.g. file) to delete from bucket

Raises

S3Error – Error while deleting object

file_exists_in_bucket(key: str) -> (<class 'bool'>, <class 'str'>)¶

Checks if the current file already exists in the specified bucket. If so, the file will not be uploaded (put), or will be downloaded (get)

Parameters

  • key (str) – File to check for in bucket

  • put (bool) – True if uploading (default)

Returns

True if the file already exists, False if it doesnt str: Error message, “” if none

Return type

bool

Raises

botocore.exceptions.ClientError – Error in searching bucket. 404 -> OK, not 404 -> not OK
